IdentNode.trailing: /- This module contains splitting operations on subarrays that crucially rely on `omega` for proof automation. Placing them in another module breaks an import cycle, because `omega` itself uses the array library. -/

AtomNode.trailing: -- Enforce naming conventions for index variables.

CommandDoccommentNode.comment: Splits a subarray into two parts, the first of which contains the first `i` elements and the second of which contains the remainder. -/

AtomNode.val: Splits a subarray into two parts, the first of which contains the first `i` elements and the second of which contains the remainder. -/

OtherNode.state_before: α : Type ?u.7 s : Subarray α i : Fin s.size.succ i' : Nat isLt : i' < s.size.succ this✝ : s.start ≤ s.stop this : s.stop ≤ s.array.size ⊢ s.start + i' ≤ s.stop
OtherNode.state_after: α : Type ?u.7 s : Subarray α i : Fin s.size.succ i' : Nat isLt : i' < (s.stop - s.start).succ this✝ : s.start ≤ s.stop this : s.stop ≤ s.array.size ⊢ s.start + i' ≤ s.stop

OtherNode.state_before: α : Type ?u.7 s : Subarray α i : Fin s.size.succ i' : Nat isLt : i' < (s.stop - s.start).succ this✝ : s.start ≤ s.stop this : s.stop ≤ s.array.size ⊢ s.start + i' ≤ s.stop
α : Type ?u.7 s : Subarray α i : Fin s.size.succ i' : Nat isLt : i' < s.size.succ this✝¹ : s.start ≤ s.stop this✝ : s.stop ≤ s.array.size this : s.start + i' ≤ s.stop ⊢ s.start ≤ s.start + i'
α : Type ?u.7 s : Subarray α i : Fin s.size.succ i' : Nat isLt : i' < s.size.succ this✝¹ : s.start ≤ s.stop this✝ : s.stop ≤ s.array.size this : s.start + i' ≤ s.stop ⊢ s.start + i' ≤ s.array.size

α : Type ?u.7 s : Subarray α i : Fin s.size.succ i' : Nat isLt : i' < s.size.succ this✝¹ : s.start ≤ s.stop this✝ : s.stop ≤ s.array.size this : s.start + i' ≤ s.stop pre : Subarray α := { array := s.array, start := s.start, stop := s.start + i', start_le_stop := ⋯, stop_le_array_size := ⋯ } ⊢ s.start + i' ≤ s.stop

CommandDoccommentNode.comment: Removes the first `i` elements of the subarray. If there are `i` or fewer elements, the resulting subarray is empty. -/

AtomNode.val: Removes the first `i` elements of the subarray. If there are `i` or fewer elements, the resulting subarray is empty. -/

OtherNode.state_before: α : Type ?u.724 arr : Subarray α i : Nat ⊢ min (arr.start + i) arr.stop ≤ arr.stop

CommandDoccommentNode.comment: Keeps only the first `i` elements of the subarray. If there are `i` or fewer elements, the resulting subarray is empty. -/

AtomNode.val: Keeps only the first `i` elements of the subarray. If there are `i` or fewer elements, the resulting subarray is empty. -/

OtherNode.state_before: α : Type ?u.945 arr : Subarray α i : Nat ⊢ arr.start ≤ min (arr.start + i) arr.stop
OtherNode.state_after: α : Type ?u.945 arr : Subarray α i : Nat this : arr.start ≤ arr.stop ⊢ arr.start ≤ min (arr.start + i) arr.stop

OtherNode.state_before: α : Type ?u.945 arr : Subarray α i : Nat this : arr.start ≤ arr.stop ⊢ arr.start ≤ min (arr.start + i) arr.stop
α : Type ?u.945 arr : Subarray α i : Nat ⊢ min (arr.start + i) arr.stop ≤ arr.array.size
OtherNode.state_after: α : Type ?u.945 arr : Subarray α i : Nat this : arr.stop ≤ arr.array.size ⊢ min (arr.start + i) arr.stop ≤ arr.array.size

OtherNode.state_before: α : Type ?u.945 arr : Subarray α i : Nat this : arr.stop ≤ arr.array.size ⊢ min (arr.start + i) arr.stop ≤ arr.array.size

Comment.text: -- Enforce naming conventions for index variables.
Splits a subarray into two parts, the first of which contains the first `i` elements and the second of which contains the remainder. -/
Removes the first `i` elements of the subarray. If there are `i` or fewer elements, the resulting subarray is empty. -/
Keeps only the first `i` elements of the subarray. If there are `i` or fewer elements, the resulting subarray is empty. -/
